column4: anybody use cairo dock? I downloaded it yet, I somehow... cant find it?
as in you can't find the deb or how to run it while installed via apt-get/synaptic
normally it is listed under System Tools.. you can also launch it via command line by typing cairo-dock &disown   .so that it isn't stuck to  your terminal
sometimes the menu isn't updated for a bit. possibly log out then back in.
it has lots of things including widgets of sorts.
probably the best way to enjoy cairo-dock is to get the latest .deb as version 2.X is far better than the 1.6 versino in synaptic
i have a link for the .debs if you wish.
http://developer.berlios.de/project/showfiles.php?group_id=8724  get the cairo-dock and the plugins.. install the dock first then plugins
uninstall the cairo-dock you install via synaptic before using the newer .debs
Roasted get the _x86_64.deb's
cool, try out some of the themes.. also you can mix match icons/themes and create your own. good luck
possibly look into cairo-dock. you can use it without compisiting
i've been using it almost 2 years.. on all 3 of my boxes.
I had it on 3 of my boxes... and all 3 had different issues. Does the control panel look any better by now?
how do I get cairo to move horizontally?
cairo-dock has many many options to dig through. there is a #cairo-dock channel
yeah. I see that. I see I have a ton of customizing to do so its not so... eh
just change mirros for medibuntu and all set
as ZykoticK9 suggested with the link
ifconfig
maybe that network has MAC address filtering enabled.
nope. I manage the network. :(
